title: City Health Beat 2/11/17
author: Erin Billups
description: On the February 11, 2017 episode of City Health Beat, host Erin Billups talks to the Alzheimer's Association's program director, Dr. Anafidelia Tavares, about Alzheimer's disease among African Americans.
cleaned_text: 2017 episode of City Health Beat, NY1 health reporter Erin Billups looks at the following topics and more: [Lead has been discovered](http://www.ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/education/2017/02/6/unsafe-levels-of-lead-found-in-nearly-10-percent-of-drinking-water-faucets-tested-in-city-schools.html)in a number of city schools. NY1's Lindsey Christ explains the findings. - The city launches new a new ad campaign aimed at combating sexually transmitted infections. - House Speaker Paul Ryan says the repeal and replace of Obamacare is likely this year. - The flu bug is now widespread; here in the city, about 475 people visit emergency rooms daily with symptoms. - The Alzheimer's Association's program director, Dr. Anafidelia Tavares, joins the show to take a closer look at Alzheimer's disease among African Americans. - February is heart health month. NY1's Lindsay Tuchman takes a look at some symptoms you should not ignore. - NY1's Bree Driscoll takes a closer look at sleep aids.
